creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
Working on 55632, I noticed after a test failure I got the we currently parse non HTML content (css, images , binary ...) to extract content.
It would be better to detect the right content to parse.
Could we rely on SampleResult.getContentType() ?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Probably; would need to check how the value is set up to make sure we don't skip responses that should be parsed.

A secondary issue: do browsers download embedded resources recursively?
I assume they do, but if not, then we could restrict parsing to the top-level page.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
After further investigation, I was wrong when opening this bug.

In HttpSamplerBase#downloadPageResources, this code:
String parserName = getParserClass(res);
Will return null for anything except html , wml, so NO there is no useless parsing.
